lightning.title: lightning.gs
lightning.summary: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut.
lightning.details:
Lighnting is a single page website that allows the user to upload an image, shrink it (if PNG) and then create a data URI.

Technologies used on the client-side include Backbone.js, a JavaScript port of PngCrush and various HTML5 APIs including Web Workers, File and FileReader.

The site is built on a fluid layout and extensively uses CSS3 transforms, transitions and border-radius to achieve the pop art design homage.

The code is on GitHub

pennybooks.title: Penny Books
pennybooks.summary: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut.
pennybooks.details:
Penny Books uses the Amazon API to find books that are on sale for just one penny.

Technologies used on the server-side include the HTML5 History API, history.js and the jQuery backstretch plugin.

The site is fully responsive and works and looks great on the mobile, tablet and desktop platforms.

twttwt.title: Twt Twt
twttwt.summary: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut.
twttwt.details:
twt twt uses the Twitter API to allow users to insert unicode characters into their Tweets.

Technologies used include QAuth, jQuery, jQuery Rumble plugin, Modernizr, Selectivizr and SVG.
